wrong.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: not correct, and not based on true facts
wrong.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: I think I got question 3 wrong.
I wish you’d stop trying to prove me wrong (=show that I am wrong) all the time.
It is wrong to assume that technological advance brings a higher quality of life.
it is wrong to do something
wrong.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: used to describe a situation where there are problems, or when someone is ill or unhappy
wrong.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Is anything wrong? You haven’t said more than two words since you got here.
Dave’s got something wrong with his foot.
When he didn’t come back that night, I knew that something was wrong.
there is something wrong/something is wrong
What is wrong with our society? People just don’t seem to care anymore.
wrong.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: not the one that you intended or the one that you really want
wrong.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: The letter was delivered to the wrong address.
driving on the wrong side of the road
You’ve got the wrong man. I didn’t kill her.
I think we went the wrong way at that last turning.
There’s no one called Julia here. You must have the wrong number (=wrong telephone number).
wrong.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: It’s wrong that people should have to sleep on the streets.
We all accept that it is wrong to torture people.
it is wrong to do something
There’s nothing wrong with making a profit, provided you don’t cheat anyone.
wrong.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: not suitable for a particular purpose, situation, or person
wrong.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: It’s the wrong time of year to be planning a holiday.
Anna and I were wrong for each other in dozens of ways  (=not suited for a romantic relationship with each other).
wrong.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: if something is wrong with a vehicle or machine, it stops working properly
wrong.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: There’s something wrong with the car again.
wrong.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: unpleasant and upsetting or offensive – often used humorously
wrong.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1,2:
wrong.translation[0].note_box[0].section: In most cases judges are right, but in a few they are hopelessly wrong.
People do not like to be proved wrong.
wrong.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 3: used to describe a situation where there are problems, or when someone is ill or unhappy
wrong.translation[0].note_box[1].section: There’s something wrong with this yogurt.
It was four whole days before anyone even noticed something was wrong.
Harry felt sure that something was terribly wrong.
wrong.translation[0].note_box[2].section: not correct or right – used about facts, answers etc, or people
For every wrong answer, you lose five points.
The figure he gave me was wrong.
I think you’re wrong about that.
incorrect
something that is incorrect is wrong because someone has made a mistake. Incorrect is more formal than wrong
I’m afraid these prices are incorrect.
The doctor had made an incorrect diagnosis.
inaccurate
something that is inaccurate is not exactly right and contains mistakes
inaccurate information
inaccurate measurements
The old maps were often inaccurate.
not based on true facts
Are the following statements true or false?
He was accused of giving false information to the police.
untrue
not based on true facts, especially because someone is lying or guessing
I can’t believe he said that about me. It’s completely untrue!
The allegations were untrue.
misleading
a misleading statement or piece of information makes people believe something that is wrong, especially because it does not give all the facts
The article was very misleading.
misleading statistics
misguided
a misguided decision, belief, action etc is wrong because it is based on bad judgment or understanding
That decision seems misguided now.
It was the consequence of a misguided economic policy.
mistaken
wrong – used about ideas and beliefs. Also used about a person being wrong. You’re mistaken  sounds more polite and less direct than saying you’re wrong
She’s completely mistaken if she thinks that I don’t care about her.
a mistaken belief
wrong.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: What? Have I done it wrong?
I asked him to sort those files, but he’s done it all wrong (=in completely the wrong way).
wrong.translation[1].note_box[0].section: The book is a thriller about a diamond robbery that goes badly wrong.
From that moment on, everything went horribly wrong for the team.
Help was close at hand in case the stunt went disastrously wrong.
A father and son died in a fire after a good deed for a friend went tragically wrong.
If things go wrong, they’ll blame me.
If something goes wrong with your machine, you can take it back to the dealer.
Turn right and then right again - you really can’t go wrong.
if anything can go wrong, it will
I’m sure that if anything can go wrong, it will.
wrong.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: behaviour that is not morally right
wrong.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: He’s too young to know right from wrong.
Those who do wrong should be punished.
Nathan adored her, and she could do no wrong in his eyes.
wrong.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: an action, judgment, or situation that is unfair
wrong.translation[2].definitions[1].note: right a wrong (=bring justice to an unfair situation)
wrong.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The black population suffered countless wrongs at the hands of a racist regime.
wrong.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to treat or judge someone unfairly
wrong.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Both sides felt that they had been wronged.
